title: How could I politely ask someone to reread an email? - Quora

response.answer_text: The best way to make someone reread your initial email is just to send another one. A follow-up. The follow-up email is a great way to draw one’s attention. But before starting to write a follow-up email, you must first define what your objective is to create a more efficient call-to-action. These three phrases we’ve all seen a million times: "Just checking in to see ...""Thought I would just check in and find out ...""Wanted to just check-in to hear ..."But the truth is, these examples are often monotonous and ineffective. Start your email by adding a hint of context. After all, you are trying to get someone’s attention for a good reason. Think about different email subject lines. Those catchy ones tend to have more chances to be opened. Timing is also a key component. Knowing the right time will help you achieve your goals a lot faster and more efficient.
You can ask someone to read an email again, but the purpose should be given. For most people, once is plenty. Have a very valid reason that you explain, or let go of this.
